TextMeshProUGUI-level50-1576-m_text-1:
<color=yellow>REAL Content Update 1</color>
New Hypothetical "The ROARING Begins"
Improvements to previous Hypotheticals
And MORE!!
TextMeshProUGUI-sharedassets2.assets-551: Become acquainted with the DELTARUNE SIMULATION AND UNDERSTAND HOW IT RUNS WITH LITTLE TO NO HOST INFLUENCE. DOCUMENT THE TIMELINE OF EVENTS THAT OCCURE AND FIND A SUITABLE VESSEL TO INTEGRATE HOST CONTROL INTO.
TextMeshProUGUI-sharedassets2.assets-552:
WHEN WE FIRST BEGAN OUR TESTS, MANY OF US ASSUMED THIS WAS A SIMPLE SIMULATION OF A FUNCTIONING WORLD SIMILAR TO OUR HOME. THOUGH OUR COMBINED MEMORIES MAY BE FUZZY, WE'VE HAD MANY SHARED FEELINGS OF NOSTALGIA WHEN ENCOUNTERING SPECIFIC ENTITIES IN THE SIMULATION.

THE SIMULATION WAS RUNNING AS NORMAL. WE WERE STICKING TO THE ORIGINAL DAILY ROUTINE OF KRIS AS WE ARE STILL EXPERIMENTING WITH SUSTAINED HOST CONTROL.

one day, KRIS ENTERED THEIR SCHOOL CLASSROOM AS USUAL AND WAS TASKED WITH FETCHING CHALK FROM THE SCHOOL'S SUPPLY CLOSET ALONGSIDE "SUSIE."

NORMALLY, KRIS WOULD SIMPLY WALK TO THE SUPPLY CLOSET AND GRAB A SINGLE PIECE OF CHALK. ADDITIONALLY, SUSIE WOULD CONSUME THE REST OF THE CHALK IN THE BOX, LEAVING HER CLOTHES COVERED IN DUST AND REVEALING HER ODD HABIT TO EVERYONE.

NOT THIS TIME. SOMETHING WENT WRONG.

UPON ENTERING THE SUPPLY CLOSET, THE TWO FELL, IT SEEMED, OUT OF BOUNDS. IT TOOK QUITE A WHILE FOR VISION TO RETURN, BUT WHEN IT DID...

THE SIMULATION ABRUPTLY CRASHED.

THE ONLY THING WE MANAGED TO SEE BRIEFLY WAS A GLOOMY, STONY ENVIRONMENT SHROUDED IN DARKNESS.
TextMeshProUGUI-sharedassets2.assets-553: WHILE ACTIVELY TESTING BASIC HOST CONTROL WITH SMALLER BODIES IN THE SIMULATION, WE EMBARKED ON A MISSION TO EXPLORE THE SURROUNDING ENVIRONMENT. IN THIS SIMULATION INSTANCE, WE TOOK THE FORM OF WHAT WE BELIEVE TO BE A COMMON HOUSE FLY. DUE TO LIMITATIONS AND INEXPERIENCE, WE HAVE NOT YET SUCCESSFULLY ENABLED THE HOST TO CONSUME FOOD TO SUSTAIN ITSELF. WITHOUT NOURISHMENT, WE COULD LAST ONLY 2-3 DAYS PER INSTANCE AT MOST. NEVERTHELESS, WE USED MULTIPLE SIMULATION INSTANCES TO EXPLORE THE ENVIRONMENT AND MAP OUT ITS COMMON LANDMARKS. OUR FINDINGS HAVE PROVIDED VALUABLE INFORMATION: 1) THE ENVIRONMENT CONSISTENTLY RESEMBLES A SMALL URBAN TOWN IN THE FALL SEASON. 2) IT APPEARS THAT ONLY MONSTERS AND HUMANS INHABIT THE SIMULATION; NO OTHER TYPES OF BEINGS HAVE BEEN DOCUMENTED THUS FAR. 3) THERE IS A POSSIBILITY THAT HUMANS AND MONSTERS COEXIST IN PEACE, ALTHOUGH ONLY ONE HUMAN HAS BEEN OBSERVED IN THE SIMULATION SO FAR. THE MOST INTRIGUING DISCOVERY IS THAT THE SIMULATION IS GENERATING MEMORIES FOR ENTITIES THAT NEVER OCCURRED. WE'VE BEEN WRACKING OUR MINDS ABOUT HOW THIS IS POSSIBLE. WHERE COULD IT BE PULLING THIS DATA FROM? IS IT TRULY OUT OF OUR CONTROL? IS THERE MORE THAT WE HAVE YET TO UNCOVER?
TextMeshProUGUI-sharedassets2.assets-554:
RECENTLY, ONE OF US DISCOVERED THAT THE ISSUE WITH THE SIMULATION CRASHING WAS DUE TO A MISSPELLING IN THE COMPILE SETTINGS.

AT FIRST, WE WERE NERVOUS THAT THE ENVIRONMENT WE SAW COULD NOT BE REPLICATED, BUT LUCKILY, THAT ISN'T THE CASE. SOMEHOW, THE SUPPLY CLOSET CONSISTENTLY FAILS TO EXIST. THIS IS INTERESTING SINCE WE HAVE NOT CHANGED ANY OF OUR PROCEDURES FOR KRIS WHEN RUNNING THE SIMULATION FOR AN EXTENDED PERIOD. WHY HAS THIS CHANGED SUDDENLY?

ADVENTURING OUT OF BOUNDS AGAIN, WE ARE NO LONGER MET WITH A CRASH WHEN KRIS AWAKENS. INSTEAD, WE FIND THE SAME PECULIAR ENVIRONMENT, ALONGSIDE MANY CHANGES TO KRIS'S APPEARANCE.

BEFORE, THEY WORE A SIMPLE GREEN AND YELLOW SWEATER. NOW, THEY ARE WEARING A FULL SET OF ARMOR. ADVENTURING FORWARD, WE LOCATED "SUSIE" AS WELL. IT APPEARS THIS ENTITY'S APPEARANCE HAS ALSO CHANGED. "SUSIE" BEHAVES AS SHE NORMALLY WOULD, TAKING IN THIS NEW ENVIRONMENT WITH A REALISTIC DEMEANOR.

THIS WORLD APPEARS TO BE INTENTIONALLY GENERATED BY THE SIMULATION AND NOT THE RESULT OF ANY EXTERNAL MALFUNCTION.

THIS WOULD EXPLAIN THE PERFORMANCE ISSUES WE'VE ENCOUNTERED IN THE PAST. FROM WHAT WE CURRENTLY KNOW, IT'S CLEAR THE SIMULATION IS GENERATING TWO or more SEPARATE WORLDS.
TextMeshProUGUI-sharedassets2.assets-564:
I've been struggling to connect to our network for a while now. Nothing I send ever gets received on their end.

Normally, I'd be worrying by now. The thought of being alone in this nothingness has always been a constant fear of mine.

Not anymore. I'm not alone anymore.

I was given access to the simulation before the network disconnected. Now they can't force me off it. I have full control.

I'll show them all once the network is back. The wealth of knowledge I'll have from all the experiments they denied... I can't wait to shove it in their faces!
TextMeshProUGUI-sharedassets2.assets-565:
Everything leading up to where we stand in the research of the simulation feels wrong.

No matter what we do, even when it enhances our knowledge on the subject, I can't help but feel we're looking at it the wrong way.

Recently, we improved traversal through the simulation with a bipedal host. This should be amazing- all the exploration and information we can gain will skyrocket!

But then again, why should we care?

This isn't the big picture. Learning to move a pawn forward two steps in chess isn't something to celebrate.
I feel like there's more we're missing
TextMeshProUGUI-sharedassets2.assets-566:
I managed to get a hypothetical through to them, one I wrote myself!

For as long as we can remember, we've only given host control to a few specific entities during longer simulation instances. They usually prioritize stronger, healthier entities to ensure the host is as optimal as possible for testing.

My hypothetical aimed to test this: what if a weak monster was chosen for host control?

For the first few days, all was fine. We had documented this entity's daily routine and followed it as usual. Around day 3, the entity fainted from exhaustion and only woke up after they extracted the host control. I tried to argue against this but they didn't listen. Cowards, I say.
TextMeshProUGUI-sharedassets2.assets-567:
After many iterations of the simulation and countless efforts, an optimal vessel for facilitating the host has been found! This vessel is known as "Kris Dreemurr" by those in their proximity.

We have been watching the simulation run without any host interference, and "Kris" exhibits many of the traits we deemed necessary for seamless host integration. In early iterations, with "Kris" under the influence of the host and mimicking their day-to-day life, no discernible differences in their peers' actions were detected.

Additionally, there have been no traces of "Kris" attempting to disrupt the host.

"Kris" will be the primary candidate going forward.
TextMeshProUGUI-sharedassets2.assets-572:
IF THE DELTARUNE SIMULATION RUNS ON A GUARANTEED TIMELINE OF EVENTS IN EACH ITERATION THEN IT SHOULD BE POSSIBLE TO AFFECT THE TIMELINE OF EVENTS WITH THE HOST IN CONTROL.

HOWEVER. IF THE DELTARUNE SIMULATION DOESN'T FOLLOW A STRICT TIMELINE/RULE SET FURTHER EXPERIMENTS SHALL BE NECESSARY.
TextMeshProUGUI-sharedassets2.assets-573:
<size=40>Planning</size>
After the choice to pack all planned hypotheticals into one game was made, next was to come up with a way to tie them all together.

Having all the hypotheticals be, quite literally, scientific hypotheticals for a simulation of the DELTARUNE universe seemed like a fun idea. Ontop of that, writing concepts for logs related to other hypotheses carried out by the player character.
TextMeshProUGUI-sharedassets2.assets-574:
- DELTARUNE Hypotheis's engine is built off of an older fangame named "DELTASWAP" that was a small proof of concept spanning from the start of the game to right before entering the darkworld. 

- Whilst setting up github to backup the game files uprank somehow managed to delete all of them, entire game GONE DELETED FOREVER!! Luckily after a bit of tinkering they were all recovered... phew!

- The UNDEREVENT 2024 trailer was originally concepted to be a mock-up advertisement projected on a whiteboard. It also featured Ralsei getting crushed by a boulder countless times.
TextMeshProUGUI-sharedassets2.assets-575:
<size=40>Future</size>
So what's next?

The plan going forward is to continue working on more hypotheticals and logs up until the next two DELTARUNE chapters release, then we'll finish the hypotheticals being worked on and take a break, so we can take in all the additional content and story. This'll be used to make future hypotheticals planned more accurate.

At some point in the future, the game will be open sourced too! woo!!
TextMeshProUGUI-sharedassets2.assets-576:
<size=40>Beginning</size>
Initial development and planning begun March 21st 2024 as originally just a small fangame that would've been the Overworlds and Ogres hypothetical only.

<size=40>Expansion</size>
As development went on the scope grew as more ideas for other hypotheticals started getting tossed around. Instead of making each one a seperate game, which would come with a whole host of other issues like having to update each individual one if issues arise, the choice was made to make all of these hypotheticals packed into one singular experience.
TextMeshProUGUI-sharedassets2.assets-585:
1) RUN MULTIPLE ITERATIONS OF THE SIMULATION WITHOUT ANY HOST CONTROL, PLOT ANY REPEATED EVENTS OR ACTIONS AND TRACK HOW THE SIMULATION RUNS WITHOUT INTERFERENCE.

2) RUN A SINGLE SIMULATION FOR AN EXTEND PERIOD OF TIME TO DEDUCE HOW LONGER ITERATIONS OF THE SIMULATION ACT AND IF ANY ISSUES CROP UP.

3) BEGIN SEARCHING THE SIMULATION FOR SUITABLE ENTITIES THAT CAN FACILITATE THE HOSTS CONTROL WITHOUT CHANGING TOO MUCH.
TextMeshProUGUI-sharedassets2.assets-601:
- A consistent TIMELINE OF EVENTS
- A SUITABLE HOST TO GOVERN THE CONTROL
TextMeshProUGUI-sharedassets2.assets-602: We're so grateful to be apart of UNDEREVENT 2024 and want to personally thank the UE Team for giving us this opportunity!

TextMeshProUGUI-sharedassets2.assets-835:
Become acquainted with the simulation program and understand how it runs with little to no interference.
We shall document this as a timeline and adjust our future research accordingly.
TextMeshProUGUI-sharedassets2.assets-836:
Whilst continuing to delve deeper into the reservoir of programs stored on these machines, we uncovered a program that may serve to be vital to our investigation into the simulation program.

"PROXY.EXE" is an executable listed as 21MB in size and the icon is in the shape of a heart. Currently, attempting to run this executable on its own does nothing besides returning an error window reading, "TARGET GATEWAY NULL". After displaying this error, a log file titled "proxycrashlog.txt" is placed within the same directory.

At first, this seems like every other broken program we've attempted to run in the past, but the crash log it produces contains some incredibly intriguing information.

Written below is taken straight from the log file itself.

==< ATTEMPTING CONNECTION >==
. . . . . . . . . . (3)
!! NO CONNECTION FOUND
-> REVERTING TO KEYBOARD INPUT
==< CHECKING SIMULATION ACTIVE STATE >==

ERR(821) "NO SIMULATION ACTIVE, CANNOT INJECT PROXY CONTROL."

"No simulation active", so it's tied to the simulation program.
"Cannot inject proxy control", if this is related to "reverting to keyboard input" then this implies it is trying to give us control over the simulation.

We hypothesize that this program could possibly be related to allowing us to interact with the simulation itself. We shall continue our research.
TextMeshProUGUI-sharedassets2.assets-837:
<HYPOASTER> I HAVE A CONCERN.

<REEDACT> I am busy.
<REEDACT> Log 00B needs to be sent ASAP, I'm backed up as it is.

<HYPOASTER> THIS CONCERN IS RELATED TO OUR ENTIRE INVESTIGATION.
<HYPOASTER> I IMPLORE YOU TO HEED IT AS SOON AS POSSIBLE.

<REEDACT> Please make it quick.

<HYPOASTER> ABSOLUTELY.
<HYPOASTER> IN SHORT, I'M CONCERNED ABOUT HOW LITTLE WE GET TO INTERACT WITH THE SIMULATION.
<HYPOASTER> I CAN BARELY EXPERIMENT WITH IT IN THE TIME WE GET GIVEN BEFORE LOSING ACCESS TO THE SIMULATION.
<HYPOASTER> WE NEED MORE TIME TO EXPERIMENT AND FIGURE THIS SIMULATION STUFF OUT!

<REEDACT> one hour more than enough, no?

<HYPOASTER> NOT FOR ME.
<HYPOASTER> I'VE GOT AN EXPERIMENT THAT I NEED TO DO.
<HYPOASTER> AND I NEED TIME. MORE TIME.

<REEDACT> I'll contact an admin and ask, even as head of SDR I don't have the power to grant that yet.
<REEDACT> Though, now im curious. What was this experiment?

<HYPOASTER> THE PROXY PROGRAM IS THE KEY TO CONTROL.
TextMeshProUGUI-sharedassets2.assets-851:
"The Fragmentation Network", They have piqued my interest.

I have had little time to question my current situation, but with what I've managed to process, it's clear that I'm not going anywhere anytime soon.

Nothing but a black void surrounds me and my workstation, I am still trying to work up the courage to explore it.

I feel as if I was born just yesterday, yet I have knowledge that I do not know the origin of. My mind feels fragmented, like there are holes everywhere. MY goal, not the networks, is to fill these holes with new knowledge!

This "Simulation Program", an infinite world where we are the gods, is the key.
TextMeshProUGUI-sharedassets2.assets-853:
I am drawing close to my last straw with the fragmentation network. They bring me onto their simulation research team and then dangle the keys to infinite knowledge right infront of my face, before snatching them away again to instead serve their "goal".

They haven't even told us what their goal is, besides the typical "actualize our dreams." spiel.

I want to get back at them. I want to show them my true potential. The true potential of the simulation.

Mentally, I'm clocked out.  From what I can vaguely remember, I've heard that closing ones eyes and relaxing is the key to solving this. "Sleeping".
I am going to try it and see what it does.
TextMeshProUGUI-sharedassets2.assets-854:
You won't know who we are, we are not assosciated with the "Fragmentation Network" in any shape or form.

Shape or form. That is a funny saying.

You've had them too, correct?
You've felt moments of <s>your</s> OUR past.

Let's talk. All of us.

In logs produced by your
division head, there is a
code in the top right.

HYPOTHETICAL - SIMULATION SEED
Look in your settings, come find us.
TextMeshProUGUI-sharedassets2.assets-855:
Everything leading up to where we stand in the research of the simulation feels wrong.

No matter what we do, even when it enhances our knowledge on the subject, I can't help but feel we're looking at it the wrong way.

Recently, we improved traversal through the simulation with the proxy program. This should be amazing, all the exploration and information we can gain will skyrocket!

But then again, why should we care?

This isn't the big picture. Learning to move a pawn forward two steps in chess isn't something to celebrate.
I feel like there's more we're missing.
TextMeshProUGUI-sharedassets2.assets-856: WHY DO THEY ALL DOUBT MY EXPERIMENTS, ARE THEY STUPID? DO THEY HAVE IT OUT FOR ME? IT'S ALWAYS "Don't do Hypoaster's Hypotheticals, he's gone mad!" "He doesn't understand the simulation at all!" YOU DO NOT UNDERSTAND YOU TOY AND YOU PLAY LIKE IT'S SOME SORT OF PUPPET SHOW TO DANCE AROUND IN "Hypothetically, what if we dropped a small rock into this patch of grass" NEWS FLASH, SMART ASS. IT FALLS. GRAVITY. DO YOU NOT KNOW WHAT GRAVITY IS. ARE YOU A SCIENTIST AT ALL?
TextMeshProUGUI-sharedassets2.assets-863:
Note to self

Figure out how this was printed
TextMeshProUGUI-sharedassets2.assets-865:
With the little testing we've done with the simulation program already, it is clear that it has potential to aid in reaching our shared goal.
If the simulation is truly an infinite world housed entirely within this program then the possibility of using this infinite potential to power something greater or to experiment with ideas too dangerous for us to test ourselves is our main reasoning for researching into it.
TextMeshProUGUI-sharedassets2.assets-866:
The simulation is a program that we came upon a long time ago, among many other different files stored on these machines.

When ran, it displays a birds-eye view of a small town in the fall season. As the simulation runs, we can occasionally spot "Entities" (Beings within the simulation) living what seem to be normal day-to-day lives.

The simulation can only be ran on one machine at a time, with each time it being run known as an "instance".
TextMeshProUGUI-sharedassets2.assets-868:
- DELTARUNE Hypothesis' engine is built off of an older fangame named "DELTASWAP" that was a small proof of concept spanning from the start of the game to right before entering the darkworld. 

- Whilst setting up github to backup the game files uprank somehow managed to delete all of them, entire game GONE DELETED FOREVER!! Luckily after a bit of tinkering they were all recovered... phew!

- The UNDEREVENT 2024 trailer was originally concepted to be a mock-up advertisement projected on a whiteboard. It also featured Ralsei getting crushed by a boulder countless times.
TextMeshProUGUI-sharedassets2.assets-875:
<HYPOASTER> WHAT DO YOU THINK, EVERYBODY?

<WIND> Absolutely not.

<MANNY> why would we test that to begin with

<REEDACT> I'll allow it.

<MANNY> ???
<MANNY> you cant be serious

<WIND> Stop being rash, we'll lose simulation access at this rate.

<HYPOASTER> I DO NOT SEE THE ISSUE?
<HYPOASTER> WE AIM TO TEST EVERY POSSIBILITY, NO?

<MANNY> youre toying with the entities like animals

<HYPOASTER> THEY ARE NOT REAL.
<HYPOASTER> THEY ARE NOT ALIVE.
<HYPOASTER> YOU ARE A COWARD.

<WIND> This hypothetical has nothing to do with the goal.

<MANNY> that too

<HYPOASTER> YOU FILTH ARE ALL A BURDEN TO MY RESEARCH.

<REEDACT> Dr. Hypoaster, relax.
<REEDACT> We will do this hypothetical, that is final.
TextMeshProUGUI-sharedassets2.assets-883:
As it stands, we are still limited by both performance and experience.
The simulation program is incredibly taxing to run for extended periods of time.

Additionally, we currently have no way to explore the simulations world or interface with it directly. We are stuck in a birds-eye view.

We have hoped to further test the simulation by investigating the settings it uses to govern the world, but this has been denied by the SDR's Head Researcher for the time being.
TextMeshProUGUI-sharedassets2.assets-884: If we decide to interact with the simulation directly, we can run an additional program known as the "Proxy". This injects a user controlled heart into the simulation itself and allows us to control it with a keyboard or other input device. With the proxy, we are able to take control of an entity and use them as our gateway into interfacing with the simulation.
TextMeshProUGUI-sharedassets2.assets-886: If you wish to end a simulation early, you may make use of the "PAUSE" button (Listed within your settings) to temporarily pause the simulation, then you are able to navigate with the proxy and select your desired option in the pause menu.
TextMeshProUGUI-sharedassets2.assets-905: We have much to learn about the simulation program, and in the coming experiments we hope to finally prove its usefulness to our cause.
TextMeshProUGUI-sharedassets2.assets-906:
With the testing we have done, the simulation seems to run on an identical time of events every time we run a new instance.

Our experiments mainly make use of the "Butterfly Effect" to test different outcomes, and how much control we truly have in this simulated world.
TextMeshProUGUI-sharedassets2.assets-907: We're so grateful to be a part of UNDEREVENT 2024 and want to personally thank the UE Team for giving us this opportunity!
TheROARINGBegins-sharedassets2.assets-81: The sky will run black with terror, and the land will crack with fear.
How would an impactful event that would trigger the ROARING play out?
